source:
# Project: Noshow Medical Appointment Anaylsis ## Table of Contents
  • Introduction
  • Data Wrangling
  • Exploratory Data Analysis
  • Conclusions

## Introduction This dataset collects information from 100k medical appointments in Brazil and is focused on the question of yes or no patients show up for their appointment , so we need to investigate the factors that patients does not show up for their appointment. We have 14 variables : PatientId AppointmentID Gender ScheduledDay AppointmentDay Age Neighbourhood Scholarship Hipertension Diabetes Alcoholism Handcap SMS_received No-show

# we need to import because it is important to import the needed python libararies which can help with our analysis.
import numpy as np 
import pandas as pd
%matplotlib inline 
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns
sns.set()

## My Questions: 1) What is the proportion of gender for no-show? 2) What is the rate of people who missed their appointment based on Age? 3) What is the effect of sending SMS to the patients ? ## Data Wrangling For this section of the report, you will load in the data, check for cleanliness, and then trim and clean your dataset for analysis. Make sure that you document your steps carefully and justify your cleaning decisions.

medical_data.nunique()

## Changing Variables names 
we need to change some variables names to make it more clear

Hipertension to Hypertension with correct spelling 

PatientId is not organized well so changing it to Patient_id 

AppointmentId same case so , to Appointment_id

ScheduledDay same , to Scheduled_day

AppointmentDay , to Appointment_day

handcap change to,  hindrance

to make easier we change no-show to no_show
## Data Cleaning :

medical_data.rename(columns={'PatientId':'Patient_id','AppointmentID':'Appointment_id',
                     'ScheduledDay':'Scheduled_day','AppointmentDay':'Appointment_day',
                     'Hipertension':'Hypertension','Handcap':'Hindrance','No-show':'No_show'}, inplace=True)
medical_data.head(6)
There are some columns are not useful , so dropping them will be better such as , Appointemt_id & Patient_id

source:
#dropping unneeded columns
medical_data.drop(['Patient_id', 'Appointment_id'], axis=1, inplace= True)
medical_data.head(1)
We have some columns have two types in both so , we need to change to date_time using datetime function

# we have to convert Apponintment_day & Scheduled_day to datetime 
medical_data['Scheduled_day'] = pd.to_datetime(medical_data['Scheduled_day'])
medical_data['Appointment_day'] = pd.to_datetime(medical_data['Appointment_day'])

#checking for conversion of previous columns 
medical_data['Scheduled_day']= medical_data['Scheduled_day'].apply(lambda x:x.strftime('%m-%d-%y'))
medical_data['Scheduled_day'].head(3)

# for the other column 
medical_data['Appointment_day']= medical_data['Appointment_day'].apply(lambda x:x.strftime('%m-%d-%y'))
medical_data['Appointment_day'].head(3)

medical_data.head()
# the description of the data
medical_data.describe()
we have -1 value in age so , we need to drop to make the data better
#dropping the value
medical_data.drop(medical_data.loc[medical_data['Age']==-1].index, inplace=True)

#checking if the value is dropped
medical_data['Age'].value_counts()
it is removed
medical_data.drop([ 'Scheduled_day', 'Appointment_day','Neighbourhood','Scholarship'], axis=1, inplace=True)

source: # checking the state of the data
medical_data.info()
## Exploratory Data Analysis ## 1) What is the proportion of gender for no-show?

text/html:
No_show
Gender
F 64.997376
M 35.002624

source:
#Depending on Gender for show up and no show , which has the highest rate
absence_appointment=pd.DataFrame(medical_data.groupby('Gender')['No_show'].count()).apply(lambda x : x / sum(x) * 100)
absence_appointment
As we can see Female is greater than male regarding of no show , Female are 65% & male 34%
Generally , as we can see the number of Females are approximately twice higher than Males

absence_appointment= medical_data.groupby('Gender').No_show.value_counts().unstack().plot(kind='bar',width =1,figsize=(12,9), color=['white','blue'])
absence_appointment.set_title("No show rate by Gender")
plt.ylabel("Number of No show and show")
plt.xlabel("Gender of No show and show")
plt.legend(['No_show','show']);
plt.show()

The majority of appointment absence was for Female

Also , Female has Higher attendance rate than Male
## 2) What is the highest rate of disease for patients ?

#Which disease does the patients have more than the other
df = pd.DataFrame({'Diseases':[  'Hypertension','Diabetes', 'Alcoholism','Hindrance'], 
                    'value':[medical_data.Hypertension.sum(), medical_data.Diabetes.sum(), medical_data.Alcoholism.sum(),medical_data.Hindrance.sum()]})
df.plot.bar(x='Diseases', y='value', rot=0 ,title="Statistic of Diseases")
As we can see Hypertension disease has highest value
## 3) What is the effect of sending SMS to the patients ?
As we can see , SMS received has no effect on the No_show column

## Conclusions To sum up , the number of Females patients in all aspects is higher than the males such as , No_show , show up, and the number generally . Sending messages to the patients has less effect.Also, patients have many diseases , and the one with highest number of people is Hypertension.

## Limitations

As we see there was a negative value regarding age , and data type of two columns were not good so we convert it .
